Fighting #ClimateChange is not just the moral thing to do but also the wise thing to do to secure the financial futures of hard-working Americans. Now let’s get to work on getting the #RESPONDAct passed into law!
The data we’ve seen to date is clear: #ClimateChange poses a massive risk to our economy & this bill will ensure the retirement benefits of millions of federal workers are protected from those risks.

The more we examine how #ClimateChange impacts our financial system the better we can protect the livelihoods of  our nation’s valuable workforce while incentivizing corporations to quickly transition to renewable energy sources.

Should these studies determine pensions would yield greater results if they implement low-carbon investment strategies then the Federal Retirement Thrift Investment Board would immediately be directed to transition their investment practices accordingly.

The #RESPONDAct would establish the necessary resources to analyze the adverse effects of #ClimateChange on the economy and require annual reports projecting and accounting for these costs including how they impact the pensions of federal workers.

As the world continues to transition away from fossil fuels to protect future generations it’s important that federal retirees aren’t set up to fail with retirement portfolios heavily invested in the fossil fuel industry.

With the #RESPONDAct @RepRashida and I are calling on financial regulators to examine the economic costs of #ClimateChange and utilize the data to make sound investments on behalf of more than 5.5 million federal employees.
I am proud to work with @RepRashida to introduce the #RESPONDAct legislation that would protect federal pensions from the economic impacts of #ClimateChange. https://t.co/8FA3co7p3q
